hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Momentum
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC 20-day realized volatility falls below its 60-day rolling 20th percentile (compression) while the BTC 1-month 25-delta skew remains neutral (between -5 and +5), a subsequent 5% price move in either direction within 3 days will initiate a sustained trend in that direction for the next 10 trading days, with the trend continuation probability exceeding 65%.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression periods with neutral skew suggest balanced positioning and suppressed uncertainty. A sharp breakout from such conditions often attracts momentum flows as traders chase the new direction, creating self-reinforcing price action. The neutral skew indicates no strong hedging bias, allowing for cleaner directional moves.
entry_conditions: BTC 20D realized volatility < 20th percentile of 60D rolling window
BTC price moves ≥5% from previous day's close in either direction (breakout trigger)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: 3% loss from entry price (if breakout fails)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout direction reversal within 3 days occurs in >40% of instances, or post-breakout volatility expansion fails to sustain directional momentum.
